intro: Melandrium dingriense, commonly known as the Dingri sandcatcher, is a flowering plant native to the Tibetan Plateau. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
